remarks: In an algebraic closure system, if two independent sets have equal closure and one is infinite, then they are equinumerous.  This is proven by using ~ acsdomd twice with ~ acsinfd .  See Section II.5 in [Cohn] p. 81 to 82.  (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
statement:
acsinfdimd.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( ACS ` X ) ) $.
acsinfdimd.2 $e |- N = ( mrCls ` A ) $.
acsinfdimd.3 $e |- I = ( mrInd ` A ) $.
acsinfdimd.4 $e |- ( ph -> S e. I ) $.
acsinfdimd.5 $e |- ( ph -> T e. I ) $.
acsinfdimd.6 $e |- ( ph -> ( N ` S ) = ( N ` T ) ) $.
acsinfdimd.7 $e |- ( ph -> -. S e. Fin ) $.
acsinfdimd $p |- ( ph -> S ~~ T ) $.
